thread.title: Season tickets available for LSO's five-concert, 69th season
thread.title_full: Season tickets available for LSO's five-concert, 69th season

author: Staff
title: Season tickets available for LSO's five-concert, 69th season
text: Season tickets available for LSO's five-concert, 69th season LSO season also includes guest pianist, classical guitarist, cellist Posted: October 11, 2015 - 12:04am LSO Masterworks concerts ■ What: David Cho, Lubbock Symphony Orchestra maestro and music director, and will conduct four of the year’s five Masterworks concert weekends, beginning with 7:30 p.m. performances Friday and Saturday at the Lubbock Memorial Civic Center Theatre. ■ When: Nov. 6 and 7, Jan. 22 and 23, March 4 and 5 (with guest conductor), and April 29 and 30. ■ Season tickets: $210 and $170 for the general public, and $160 and $140 for all students. ■ Individual concert tickets: $50, $40 and $25 for the general public, and $38, $33 and $15 for the general public. ■ Soundbites dinners: Served at the Civic Center at 6 p.m., before each concert. Price includes catered meal, along with pre-concert comments by Cho and occasional guest artists. $20 per person, or $100 for a five-weekend, season package. ■ Information and tickets: 762-3233. Concerts ■ Friday and Saturday: Verdi’s Messa da Requiem. Guest artists include Lubbock Chorale, Texas Tech Choir and vocalists Cody Austin, tenor; David Grogan, bass; Jill Grove, alto; and Rebecca Wascoe-Hays, soprano. ■ Nov. 6 and 7: Overture to “School for Scandal” by Samuel Barber, Piano Concerto in F by George Gershwin abd Symphony No. 7 by Beethoven. Guest artist: Andrew Staupe, piano, playing Piano Concerto in F. ■ Jan. 22 and 23: “Three-Cornered Hat” by Manuel De Falla, Concierto de Aranjuez by Joaquin Rodrigo and Symphony No. 9 (New World Symphony) by Antonin Dvorak. Guest artist: David Brandon, classical guitar, playing Concierto de Aranjuez. ■ March 4 and 5: Festive Overture Op. 96, by Dmitri Shostakovichm, “Tristan und Isolde,” prelude and liebestod by Richard Wagner and Symphony No. 1 by Jean Sibelius. Guest conductor: Czech conductor Bohuslav Rattay, presently music director of Midland Symphony Orchestra. ■ April 29 and 30: Academic Festival overture and Symphony No. 3 by Johannes Brahms and Cello Concerto by Dvorak. Guest artist: Maja Bogdanovic, cello, playing Dvorak’s Cello Concerto. TAGS:
